Reading

Nov 3, 2023

Original post on Oct 12, 2021

I love reading but I've bitten off more than I can chew.

I'm jumping around, reading the following books:

  • Can Science Explain Everything?, by John C. Lennox
  • The Weight Of Glory, by C. S. Lewis
  • Mathematics For Human Flourishing, by Francis Su
  • Thinking In Systems: A Primer, By Donella H. Meadows
  • Unhurried Life: Following Jesus' Rhythms of Work and Rest, by Alan Fadling
  • Divine Time Management, by Elizabeth Grace Saunders
  • Mere Christianity, by C. S. Lewis (I'm just reading this one casually)

I'll start the following when I'm done with the above:

  • The Creative Habit, by Twyla Tharp
  • Switch: How to Change Things When Change is Hard, by Chip and Dan Heath

Wishlist:

  • Switchers

I'm not a fast reader and I like to take notes, ponder, talk to myself, and write as I read.

As for onliine reading, I enjoy subjects such as tech, thinking, leadership, systems, mathematics, science, and business; as well as browse art and calligraphy from amazing creatives.

Here are 3 articles about systems thinking being applied in the real world:

  • How an NGO is turning Somalian pirates into fishermen
  • Housing is a human right: How Finland is eradicating homelessness
  • Want to Win the War on Drugs? Portugal Might Have the Answer

Here's an article in my queue:

  • The Gospel of Consumption
